body: Now, obviously I don't think the point is that you *cant* be a Christian and have strong political views (one of Jesus 12 disciples was a Zealot) but when it comes to speaking with our family and friends, and especially our church family it is so important to to be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry. Politics should not divide us.
body_html: Now, obviously I don't think the point is that you cant be a Christian and have strong political views (one of Jesus 12 disciples was a Zealot) but when it comes to speaking with our family and friends, and especially our church family it is so important to to be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry. Politics should not divide us.
title: How should Christians respond to politics?

body: I understand the sentiment here, but it's not so easy.  We can slap on the label 'politics', but politics ultimately represent some of our deeply held values.  When dealing with those who deem us monsters, I end up lashing out.  Believe me, I love God, but the practice of "love your enemy" has really felt like a cop out lately and when contemplating it I just end up more frustrated.
body_html: I understand the sentiment here, but it's not so easy. We can slap on the label 'politics', but politics ultimately represent some of our deeply held values. When dealing with those who deem us monsters, I end up lashing out. Believe me, I love God, but the practice of "love your enemy" has really felt like a cop out lately and when contemplating it I just end up more frustrated.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
> politics ultimately represent some of our deeply held values.

No they don't. Nothing about this pointless distraction of a war right now bears good fruit. It's all nonsense fighting, of the type we're supposed to stay away from.

> the practice of "love your enemy" has really felt like a cop out lately and when contemplating it I just end up more frustrated.

You are being deceived into breaking the most important commandment, in fact the *only* one as they all come from it. No one said it would be easy or feel right, we are biologically hardwired to act in our own interests. Even evil people love those who love them, so how are you any better?
body_html:
politics ultimately represent some of our deeply held values.

No they don't. Nothing about this pointless distraction of a war right now bears good fruit. It's all nonsense fighting, of the type we're supposed to stay away from.

the practice of "love your enemy" has really felt like a cop out lately and when contemplating it I just end up more frustrated.

You are being deceived into breaking the most important commandment, in fact the only one as they all come from it. No one said it would be easy or feel right, we are biologically hardwired to act in our own interests. Even evil people love those who love them, so how are you any better?

body:
The current political war is just a scheme by the uniparty to make it *look* like there's two opposing sides and distract people with controversies about non-issues, so that they both vote for their party but in reality they will both pass the exact same things when it comes to actual politics. Don't fall for it, they are all in bed with each other.

In any case politics are foolish and that's why I always advocate for as little government as possible, in my opinion we'd ideally not have one in the first place.
body_html:
The current political war is just a scheme by the uniparty to make it look like there's two opposing sides and distract people with controversies about non-issues, so that they both vote for their party but in reality they will both pass the exact same things when it comes to actual politics. Don't fall for it, they are all in bed with each other.

In any case politics are foolish and that's why I always advocate for as little government as possible, in my opinion we'd ideally not have one in the first place.

author.bio: A Trump supporter who is also a sinner and needs to rely on Jesus to save me. May God have mercy on us all. God Bless.
author.bio_html: A Trump supporter who is also a sinner and needs to rely on Jesus to save me. May God have mercy on us all. God Bless.

body:
When it comes to politics, it is important to uphold and base your opinions on God's laws. Those were given to us first through the Jewish people. These are the ten commandments, and they were further detailed by Jesus and summarized in two statements:

https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Matthew-22-40/

body: No, they are *the* commandment. People lived for millennia without the ten, knowing the real one in their hearts. Making it about the 10 commandments results in legalism, allowing evil if it's not mentioned in the 10 and wrongly forbidding other things based on instructions meant for 3400 years ago that we may either misunderstand or are not applicable. For example "Do not murder" but what if someone is terrorizing your whole community and that's the only way to stop them? Faith and the commandment and principle must guide you, not the old way of written codes and laws.
body_html: No, they are the commandment. People lived for millennia without the ten, knowing the real one in their hearts. Making it about the 10 commandments results in legalism, allowing evil if it's not mentioned in the 10 and wrongly forbidding other things based on instructions meant for 3400 years ago that we may either misunderstand or are not applicable. For example "Do not murder" but what if someone is terrorizing your whole community and that's the only way to stop them? Faith and the commandment and principle must guide you, not the old way of written codes and laws.

author.bio: A Trump supporter who is also a sinner and needs to rely on Jesus to save me. May God have mercy on us all. God Bless.

body: I admit I am not that smart when it comes to the law. I break it all the time, but I am a sinner, both in laws that I know and laws that I don't know. That is why it is good idea to rely on Jesus for forgiveness, taking each day at a time. For the example of murder, I would say the people terrorizing a community is committing murder already. Those who are defending themselves are not committing any murder. So for me the simple rule still stands, thou shalt not murder. It is a spirit within us that we must feed, let the evil spirit starve and feed the good one. I think we agree, we just use different words.
body_html: I admit I am not that smart when it comes to the law. I break it all the time, but I am a sinner, both in laws that I know and laws that I don't know.
